newsitem.title: LEBANON: Bank of Beirut in $5 mln floating-rate CD issue.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Beirut in $5 mln floating-rate CD issue.

text.p: Bank of Beirut announced on Wednesday a $5 million issue of floating-rate certificates of deposit for next week.
The 18-month CDs to be issued on December 2, carry an initial six-month annual interest of 8.25 percent. The remaining three reset periods are at six month LIBOR plus 2.75 percent.
The CDs are exempt from withholding tax.
"We expect the issue to be at least fully subscribed if not oversubscribed," Christine Dadour at the bank's treasury and foreign exchange department told Reuters.
Bank of Beirut began issuing floating-rate CDs in June 1995, and 12 issues worth the equivalent of $48 million so far have been fully subscribed, with high demand from outside Lebanon.
"There was high foreign demand mainly from the Gulf and some European institutions," Dadour said.
Bank of Beirut ranked 21st among Lebanon's 82 banks in 1994 in size of customer deposits.
